meanings.definition: Fitting in well with a person's needs, activities, and plans.
meanings.sent1: The location of the new grocery store is very convenient for our neighborhood.
meanings.sent2: Having a phone with a long battery life is very convenient for traveling.
meanings.sent3: It was quite convenient that the rain stopped just as we finished our picnic.
meanings.sent4: Her ability to adapt to any situation makes her as convenient as a Swiss Army knife.
meanings.sent5: The convenience of online shopping has changed the way we buy things.

meanings.sent1: The new software has a convenient interface that is user-friendly.
meanings.sent2: The convenience of having a gas station right next to the highway is undeniable.
meanings.sent3: It was so convenient that the elevator arrived just as I reached the lobby.
meanings.sent4: His explanation was as clear and convenient as a road sign pointing the way.
meanings.sent5: The convenience of having a microwave saves a lot of time in the kitchen.

meanings.sent1: The hotel is very convenient to the airport, making it a popular choice for travelers.
meanings.sent2: Living close to a grocery store is very convenient for quick errands.
meanings.sent3: It was convenient that the bus stop was just around the corner from the office.
meanings.sent4: The convenience of having a park nearby adds value to the neighborhood.
meanings.sent5: The convenience of having a pharmacy within walking distance is reassuring.
